As a Change Management Lead, you contribute to supporting the change management strategy, planning, implementation, training, design thinking, and workshop facilitation expertise to the talent growth initiatives within the company. You support the creation of the change management approach and oversee its successful execution in partnership with the participating stakeholders. You enable global teams to come together to share their learning and development business needs and best practices.

Like a project manager, a change management lead ensures that projects and initiatives meet their objectives in scope, timeline, and budget. Yet, while a project manager focuses on the “technical side of change” by designing and delivering the solution itself, the change management lead focuses on the “people side of change” by enabling the organization’s people to adopt and use it in their daily work.

An effective change management lead drives faster adoption, increases ultimate utilization rates, and improves user proficiency with project changes. In turn, these enhancements increase benefits to the organization, maximize return on investment, and enable the organization to achieve the results and outcomes desired from the project by also driving the sustainment of the change we want to implement.

Job Description

Diageo is the world's leading premium drinks company with an outstanding collection of brands, such as Johnnie Walker, Smirnoff, Baileys, Captain Morgan, Tanqueray and Guinness. With over 200 brands in 180 countries and a global network of entrepreneurial individuals, our teams blend a diverse range of experience, knowledge and skills. We connect customers and consumers to our iconic products and create innovative experiences that bring people together to celebrate life.

Diageo is embarking on an exciting and significant business transformation programme - Project Voyager - which will equip our business with outstanding processes, systems & data to drive our ambition to create the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products company in the world. Project Voyager will fuel long term growth for Diageo through streamlined and simplified end to end business processes, improved decision-making capabilities as a result of cleaner, near-real-time data, all underpinned by the implementation of elite technology solutions. The programme will be delivered over a multi-year period with global geographic reach.

Purpose Of Role

The Market/Function Change Champion will enable the realization of significant long-term benefits through their leadership of finance Mexico colleagues. By leading change across all levels of their organization, the role will drive adoption of new processes, data & technology solutions with a focus on two key areas:

The Change Champion will bring [Market/Function] leadership on the Voyager change journey, engaging and influencing managers & leaders within their organisation to pro-actively drive adoption of new processes, systems, ways of working & achieve operational stability from launch. They will ensure Voyager is coordinated within strategy & planning within their Mexico market. The Change Champion will build & implement change journey for impacted employees in their market ensuring local users understand, feel confident and are ready for the transition to new technology solutions, improved data, simplified processes and new ways of working.

The Change Champion will collaborate with the Market Sponsor with a dotted line into Voyager's Regional or Function Change Lead. The role will be responsible for the Market Trainer. The role will collaborate with the wider programme team - for example, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Data Support and Testers to implement change plans and support training activities. They will also support the management and delivery of the local testing plans and ensure that local data migration is validated. Main partners are end users, managers and market / function leaders.

Key Accountabilities

Build, implement and handle a change plan that drives end user adoption of Voyager-driven changes for market/function including the following:

Engagement & influence of market / function leadership: ensure consistent understanding of Voyager (e.g. scope, benefits, changes, timelines, etc.) across the relevant leadership team, resulting in 1) positive, pro-active sponsorship of the programme to their teams & 2) full integration within the business plan.
Through deep understanding of their business unit & the Voyager business transformation, the Change Champion will confidently articulate how process, system and data changes will impact their teams. Working with the wider Voyager Project team, they will build and lead execution of change mitigation activities and plans (e.g., communications, training) with the goal of ensuring adoption of process & system solutions from launch.
Design & implement engagement & communication strategy to communicate changes, benefits, and plans to end users, demonstrating relevant channels e.g., Viva Engage, email, Town Halls, face to face briefings & local networks for support. Establish a two-way mechanism, ensuring effective communication to & from the market to identify & mitigate emerging challenges.
Support [Regional/CF] Training Lead in conducting the training needs assessment for [Market/Sub Function]
Support the onboarding of market trainers, help them identify [Market/Sub Function] training needs, mapping of local user groups to learning courses & execution of training plans.
Support the localization and validation of end user role mapping for [Market/Sub Function], ensuring people have the right system access at the right time to sustain day to day operational activities and do their job effectively. Through partnership with and mentorship from the Global team, evaluate the segregation of duties and SARBOX analysis, ensuring end user compliance with local laws.
Coordinate & report local readiness activities using globally provided tools. Activities include:
Management of local test plan and resources for UAT
Support in UAT, as required
Validation of test scenarios, as required
Validation of local data quality and migration, in alignment with global data strategy, as required
Provision of local input into Readiness Assessment
Qualifications / Experience

Influential individual who has established relationships and networks with leaders and managers
Well-connected and respected by their peers; solid ability to influence and achieve outcomes with & through others.
Has a deep understanding of the Market / Function; can quickly digest how the solution impacts their business
Flexible and open to change; able to adjust to priorities based on change impacts.
Strong organizational, planning and project management skills
Strong verbal, written and communication skills - can impactful deliver a message to
Proficient in using a variety of tools to develop plans and communications content - PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Yammer, Teams, etc.

Flexibility

This is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don't let anything stop you from applying.

Diversity statement

Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo's purpose of “celebrating life every day everywhere”. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity.

We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings.
